intro: Reichelia palustris, commonly known as the marsh reichelia, is a flowering plant native to wetland environments in the Americas. It is characterized by its herbaceous growth habit and produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. The plant thrives in moist, nutrient-poor soils and is often found in marshes, swamps, and along the edges of ponds. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem, while its roots help stabilize the soil in aquatic habitats. Reichelia palustris plays a role in supporting local biodiversity by providing habitat and food for various insect species.
